remarks: Given an atom in a line, there is another atom which when joined equals the line.  (Contributed by NM, 30-Apr-2012.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
lnjat.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
lnjat.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
lnjat.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
lnjat.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
lnjat.n $e |- N = ( Lines ` K ) $.
lnjat.m $e |- M = ( pmap ` K ) $.
lnjatN $p |- ( ( ( K e. HL /\ X e. B /\ P e. A ) /\ ( ( M ` X ) e. N /\ P .<_ X ) ) -> E. q e. A ( q =/= P /\ X = ( P .\/ q ) ) ) $.
$d .<_ q $.
$d A q $.
$d B q $.
$d K q $.
$d M q $.
$d N q $.
$d P q $.
$d X q $.
